questions.question_text:
The user default login hours are 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM. The user logs in at 4:30 PM and stays on till 5:01 PM.
What happens?

discussion.content: All the Answers are confusing here as they are not aligned with the sentence itself. The correct Answer is - C and Reference - https://trailblazers.salesforce.com/answers?id=90630000000gnjEAAQ

If users are logged in when their login hours end, they can continue to view their current page, but they can’t take any further action.
https://help.salesforce.com/articleView?id=login_hours.htm&type=5

B is the correct answer.
you can view but you cannot work on that page.so D is not correct.

B is the correct option as you can't work anything on that page. you can only view that page but can't continue working on it. 
Hence, B is the right answer.

choices.C: The user terminates the session without losing any data
choices.E: The user is able to work without issues and can start new sessions
choices.D: The user is able to work without issues but cannot start new sessions
choices.B: The user loses all unsaved data after terminating the session
choices.A: The user continues with the session without any interruption
The Chatter app is added to the Force.com app menu
choices.D: All users are added to the All Chatter group
choices.B: The Chatter tab is added to all standard apps
choices.C: Accounts, Contacts, Cases, Leads and Opportunities are enabled for Chatter

discussion.content:

questions.question_text: Which salesforce.com feature allows the org to capture ROI on online advertising?
Chatter External license allow users outside the company to join public Chatter groups.

discussion.content:
Chatter External
This license is for users who are outside of your company’s email domain. These external users, also called customers, can be invited to Chatter groups that allow customers. Customers can access information and interact with users only in the groups they’re invited to. They have no access to Chatter objects or data. Chatter External users can view user profiles, but they can’t edit them.
Even if you have Chatter External, you need to create a private group to add customers.

Selected Answer: B
If customer invitations are enabled for your organization, you can invite, add, and remove customers. It must be a private group that you own or manage and that allows customers.
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.collab_external_adding.htm&type=5

FEATURE 
CHATTER EXTERNAL

(ACCESS LIMITED TO ITEMS AND PEOPLE IN THE GROUPS CUSTOMERS ARE INVITED TO)
Groups check icon indicating true

https://help.salesforce.com/articleView?id=users_license_types_chatter.htm&type=5
False because - Customers can access information and interact with users only in the groups they’re invited to.

comments.content: I believe you're mistake. Public means anyone can see and add posts, comments, and files. Anyone can join a public group. Please see this : https://trailhead.salesforce.com/content/learn/projects/prepare-your-salesforce-org-for-users/create-chatter-groups#:~:text=Chatter%20groups%20are%20classified%20as,posts%2C%20comments%2C%20and%20files.

discussion.content: I'm afraid this answer is incorrect. chatter external license is usually for customers and non company employees.
